docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Health voted yesterday to strengthen a law that requires landlords to install window guards in apartments with tenants under 10 years old. Under the former 10-year-old rules, landlord did not legally have to install the window guards unless tenants, in response to a notice from their landlord, sent a letter by certified mail saying that children under 10 lived with them. Board members said that tenants often misunderstood the requirement and that some landlords discouraged them from responding to the notices, sometimes hinting at rent increases or eviction if the tenant demanded window guards.

headline.main: CITY STRENGTHENS LAW ON WINDOW GUARDS IN APARTMENTS

docs.snippet: The Board of Health voted yesterday to strengthen a law that requires landlords to install window guards in apartments with tenants under 10 years old.   Under the former 10-year-old rules, landlord did not legally have to install the window guards...
